questions.question: Which line in the I2C protocol is used to carry the clock signal?

explanations.a: SDA is the data line, not the clock line.
explanations.b: SCL is the clock line, responsible for synchronizing communication between the master and slave.
explanations.c: VCC is the power line, not involved in data transfer.
explanations.d: GND is the ground line, not involved in data transfer.

questions.question: What happens if two I2C devices are assigned the same address?

answers.b: Data will be corrupted or lost
answers.c: Only the first device will respond
answers.d: The master will reset the bus

explanations.a: Devices with the same address will cause a conflict, not normal communication.
explanations.b: When two devices have the same address, data corruption or loss can occur.
explanations.c: The master device will not know which slave to communicate with, causing a conflict.
explanations.d: The master will not reset the bus in case of an address conflict.
